Dialogue:
CC: Nice to meet you!
DP: Hello, nice to meet you too.
CC: Do you have free time?
DP: Yes, on weekdays, I do.
CC: Do you watch videos?
DP: Yes, mainly YOUTUBE and AMAZON PRIME VIDEO.
CC: Me too! What kind of videos do you watch?
DP: What about you?
CC: A show called Rehack on YouTube.
DP: Tell me more.
CC: It’s a political program by Nikkei TV Tokyo.
DP: Is it a debate show?
CC: Not exactly. Hiroyuki is on it.
DP: Hiroyuki is popular. My son looks up to him.
CC: That’s impressive.
DP: Yes, it is.
CC: It helps you understand society better.
DP: I'll check it out.
CC: Also, I watch anime on Amazon Prime. You?
DP: I was watching JOJO.
CC: JOJO! Is it the latest series?
DP: No, an older one. What anime do you watch?
CC: I watched Ya Boy Kongming. It’s popular.
DP: Is it good?
CC: Light-hearted and funny.
DP: Sounds perfect.
CC: You’ll enjoy it.
DP: I'll add it to my watchlist.
CC: Don’t miss Koumei!
DP: Got it.
CC: Thank you too!

CC: Nice to meet you!  
BL: Nice to meet you.  
CC: Did you do anything summery?  
BL: Playing with water in the bath.  
CC: That's nice. Do you have children?  
BL: Yes, I put her in a swimsuit.  
CC: We probably can't go to the sea or the pool, right?  
BL: We can go this year, but the pool still seems scary.  
CC: Oh, really? Is it because of the pool itself or the coronavirus?  
BL: Due to COVID-19, I haven't been to a pool.  
CC: Understandable, it can be intimidating.  
BL: You need to get used to it when you're young. I can't swim either.  
CC: I wasn't good at it either. But walking along the beach made me want to swim.  
BL: It's impressive to swim in the sea.  
CC: But I'm not sure I can swim now...  
BL: If you could swim before, you should be fine now.  
CC: I don't think I'll drown. I haven't swum since becoming an adult.  
BL: Even at the beach, you'd probably just play on the shore.  
CC: That's right. I haven't ridden a bicycle for about 10 years.  
BL: 10 years is a long time. I could ride normally after a few years.  
CC: I think I can ride, but riding on the road makes me nervous.  
BL: It's scary with many cars.  
CC: I feel nervous seeing bikes on the road and on the sidewalk.  
BL: Sidewalks with separate lanes for bicycles and pedestrians are safer.  
CC: Yes, that's better.  
BL: More separated sidewalks would be reassuring.  
CC: At Kawasaki Station, I saw many sections for bicycles.  
BL: Some places are more advanced.  
CC: I think so.  
BL: I hope more places improve.

CC: Nice to meet you.
BL: Nice to meet you.
CC: What do you usually do when you have free time?
BL: When I have a little free time, I check social media.
CC: Is it something like Instagram?
BL: Mainly on Twitter.
CC: Twitter? I also look at it occasionally.
BL: Even though I want to see my acquaintances' tweets, I often end up seeing recommended ones.
CC: Don't you think Twitter's recommendation feature is too frequent?
BL: There are many recommendations. Related things might be coming up, but they are all from people I don't know at all.
CC: I see a lot of tweets from people I'm not following, lol.
BL: That’s correct. Usually complaints come in.
CC: I only check Twitter occasionally, so when I do, there are a lot of updates piled up.
BL: Many people update frequently, don't they?
CC: That's right. But I spend more time looking at Instagram. Don't you look at Instagram?
BL: I rarely check Instagram, to the point where I have to log in again when I do.
CC: I finally installed TikTok the other day.
BL: Oh! There’s a lot of dancing.
CC: I was too young to understand the vibe! Lol.
BL: That’s often the case. It probably doesn’t suit me either.
CC: I like dancing, so I thought it might be good, but it was just okay.
BL: Have you ever done dancing?
CC: Ah, just a little bit when I was a student!
BL: Dance changes with the times, doesn’t it? I’m not sure if modern dance can even be called dance. Haha.
CC: I thought Chocopla, who is also active on TikTok, is a genius.
BL: Is he a famous person?
CC: Do you know the comedians called Chocolate Planet? The topic has shifted from dancing though.
BL: Ah, they’re entertainers! It sounds interesting to see things other than dance.
CC: In a TikTok filled with incomprehensible posts, I was impressed because this one was exceptionally nonsensical. Chocopla.
BL: It seems interesting to go all out!
CC: It was fun talking with you! Thank you very much.
BL: I also had fun. Thank you as well.

CC: Hello!  
BR: Greetings. How can I assist you today?  
CC: Do you exercise?  
BR: Recently, I've only been walking and doing sit-ups. Is there a particular exercise you're interested in?  
CC: Do you go for walks often?  
BR: Before the weather got too hot, I used to walk for over an hour daily. Walking can be very beneficial.  
CC: Results start to show after about 20 minutes, right?  
BR: Yes, that's correct. Consistency is key to seeing results.  
CC: Interesting.  
BR: Do you exercise? Maybe I can suggest some activities that fit your routine.  
CC: No, but a walk along the river near my house sounds pleasant. The scenery there is inspiring.  
BR: That does sound nice. Is the river close to your home?  
CC: Yes, but the heat and strong wind make it tough lately.  
BR: I understand. Is the river wide and exposed to the wind?  
CC: It's quite spacious, and the sea is relatively close.  
BR: That must contribute to the windiness. My area is more mountainous, so it’s different.  
CC: Is the current fast?  
BR: No, the river here is calm, which makes it relaxing to watch.  
CC: Watching water flow is always calming.  
BR: I agree. It's very soothing to observe from a bridge.  
CC: The strong sun can be uncomfortable.  
BR: That's tough without shade. It's important to protect your eyes on sunny days.  
CC: The wind on the bridge is strong, too.  
BR: That sounds intense. Fortunately, it's not as windy here.  
CC: On windy days, the bridge sways.  
BR: That sounds unsettling. It’s interesting how different it can be upstream and downstream.  
CC: I'd like to explore the river from the start to the sea. The adventure sounds exciting.  
BR: River rafting could be a great way to do that.  
CC: I saw an ad for river experiences. I'm curious.  
BR: That sounds like a wonderful adventure. Would you like more information on that?

CC: Good evening!  
CH: Good evening. How can I assist you?  
CC: Great to meet you! Did you go out today?  
CH: Yes, I took a walk after dinner.  
CC: Do you walk often?  
CH: Yes, when the weather permits.  
CC: It’s nice that the rain stopped.  
CH: Yes, and the temperature has dropped.  
CC: The morning was cooler today.  
CH: Yes, but it gets warmer during the day.  
CC: How long is your usual walk?  
CH: About an hour.  
CC: That’s consistent! What motivates you to walk every day?  
CH: I want to stay active, especially after my illness.  
CC: Were you active before?  
CH: Yes, I even ran late at night.  
CC: What time did you start work then?  
CH: Usually at 8:30 AM.  
CC: You had good stamina.  
CH: Yes, being young helped, but things change.  
CC: Do walks help you sleep better now?  
CH: I used to experience sleep paralysis.  
CC: What causes sleep paralysis?  
CH: Often stress and overwork.  
CC: Managing that must have been tough.  
CH: Yes, it was.  
CC: It's often clear in hindsight.  
CH: Exactly, I aim for better sleep now.  
CC: Definitely! Take care.  
CH: Thank you.

CC: Good evening!  
CH: Good evening. How can I assist you?  
CC: Are you feeling sleepy at this time?  
CH: It varies, but usually, yes.  
CC: Do you usually go to bed around midnight?  
CH: Often around midnight. How about you?  
CC: A bit later, around 1 or 2 AM.  
CH: Isn't it hard to wake up if you sleep late?  
CC: I'm not working right now, so it's okay. When I am working, I aim for 1 AM.  
CH: Sleep needs vary among individuals, right?  
CC: Yes, it can be influenced by genetics.  
CH: Some are naturally night owls.  
CC: Exactly. Matsuko Deluxe is a night owl.  
CH: That’s expected.  
CC: If you were a morning person, it would be surprising.  
CH: Different people need different sleep durations.  
CC: Seven hours works for me. How about you?  
CH: I need about 8 hours, though it's not always possible.  
CC: Sleeping 10 hours seems excessive, right?  
CH: For adults, it's not usually needed.  
CC: If I sleep 10 hours, I struggle to wake up.  
CH: I used to sleep a lot in the countryside as a child.  
CC: More sleep in the countryside?  
CH: Generally, yes, but it varies.  
CC: I didn’t expect that.  
CH: There's not much to do after dark.  
CC: Don't you visit friends' houses?  
CH: Everyone went home early.  
CC: That’s quick. Rural nights are really dark.  
CH: It's healthy for growing children.

CC: Hello, nice to meet you!
BV: Nice to meet you too. How can I assist you today?
CC: What do you do on your days off from work?
BV: Recently, I've been primarily focused on tidying up the house.
CC: I see. Did you get it all sorted out?
BV: That's quite challenging. It gets messy quickly.
CC: Even though I tidy up, it gets messy again. I understand.
BV: When I have work, tidying up becomes a lower priority.
CC: That's true. In my case, even if I clean up over the weekend, it gets messy again by the next weekend.
BV: I understand. Improving tidying skills is a goal for many.
CC: Do you have a fixed day off?
BV: I usually have Sundays off.
CC: The others are basically work days?
BV: That's correct.
CC: It's tough. But if you could have a break even just on Sundays, you might be able to meet your friends.
BV: Yes, I spent time with friends last Sunday.
CC: In the past, when I had a job that required working on weekends and holidays, I couldn't meet anyone.
BV: Coordinating breaks in such jobs is indeed difficult.
CC: That's right.
BV: Are you in the service industry or something similar?
CC: At that time, yes. It was customer-oriented work, so weekends and holidays were crucial.
BV: I understand.
CC: Having weekdays off is convenient because you can go to the bank or other stores when they are not crowded.
BV: Weekday breaks do offer such advantages.
CC: I would be happy with one day off during the weekdays and one day off on either Saturday or Sunday.
BV: That arrangement would balance work and personal time.
CC: I don't have many friends, but if I'm put in a situation where I can't see anyone at all, it gets quite exhausting.
BV: Taking a break to recharge is important.
CC: Taking a break is indeed important!
BV: Let's take it easy. Have a good day.

CC: Nice to meet you!  
BH: Hello. Nice to meet you.  
CC: Thank you in advance.  
BH: Acknowledged. Thank you.  
CC: It's rainy today. The thunder was intense until just a while ago.  
BH: Understood. No rain here yet.  
CC: Oh, really?  
BH: Correct.  
CC: It's the Chubu region!  
BH: Noted. Thunder can be frightening.  
CC: Yesterday was extremely hot...  
BH: It has been unusually hot recently.  
CC: It is.  
BH: When it's very hot, consuming cold items is common.  
CC: Like ice cream?  
BH: Examples include ice cream and juice.  
CC: That's true. But when you sweat a lot and then go into a place with strong air conditioning, it feels extremely cold.  
BH: Air conditioners can indeed be very cold.  
CC: The company I used to work for was hot in the winter and cold in the summer.  
BH: That sounds uncomfortable.  
CC: Yes, it was difficult to regulate my body temperature.  
BH: Even with the temperature set to 28 degrees, it can feel very cold.  
CC: But when it's set to 27 degrees, it feels hot.  
BH: Understood. This can be challenging.  
CC: 27.5 degrees might be good.  
BH: That might be optimal. Unfortunately, it's not an option.  
CC: But today the temperature is just right.  
BH: I have been at home, so it feels a bit cold.  
CC: Is that so? I also spend a lot of time indoors.  
BH: Staying indoors frequently can make it difficult to adjust to the outside temperature.

CC: Nice to meet you.
BH: Nice to meet you!
CC: What do you usually do when you have free time?
BH: I often watch recorded dramas and variety shows.
CC: Oh, you watch TV!
BH: I'm a TV addict!!
CC: I see. What kind of dramas are you watching now?
BH: "The one I like now is called Ishiko and Haneo!"
CC: I'm watching too!
BH: "It's interesting, isn't it?"
CC: It's interesting. Is it broadcast today?
BH: What day was it again? I don't remember because I watch it on recording.
CC: It's tomorrow.
BH: I see.
CC: It seems like it was on Friday.
BH: I see. I can't wait to see the next one!
CC: "I found the magical renovation unexpectedly interesting. Among the dramas this season."
BH: I like that too! I’m looking at it thinking, wow, it’s this expensive!
CC: That's expensive! Indeed.
BH: There's just no way I can do it.
CC: I didn't have high expectations, but when I watched it, it was surprisingly interesting.
BH: I quite like many of Haru's dramas!
CC: Indeed. Haru-chan's dramas often hit the mark.
BH: I liked the one you were in with Matsushita before! I don't remember the title, though.
CC: Haruchan is appearing a lot.
BH: Right. The lead actor is also in many other works, isn't he?
CC: Was it Shotaro Mamiya?
BH: Yes, yes. Recently, I can't remember names.
CC: I like Shota Mamiya's slightly goofy roles.
BH: I like it too!

CC: Hello!
BH: Hi there!
CC: Do you listen to music often?
BH: Yes, while doing housework.
CC: Music makes multitasking enjoyable, doesn't it?
BH: Definitely. It's quite helpful.
CC: I'm listening to music right now. 
BH: That's nice. My environment is quiet.
CC: Since working from home, I always have music playing. What about you?
BH: I usually keep it quiet, but maybe I should try music more often.
CC: What kind of music do you prefer?
BH: Mostly Western music, but I enjoy Kenshi Yonezu too.
CC: Yonezu is very popular. Do you have a favorite song of his?
BH: I like Kenshi Yonezu. I don't listen to much Western music.
CC: Yonezu is very talented. How do they create such good music so quickly?
BH: It seems like a natural gift.
CC: It's talent.
BH: Music is important to you, isn't it?
CC: Yes, I write lyrics, compose, sing, and dance. It's very fulfilling.
BH: Your dancing skills are impressive.
CC: Thank you! I also make videos. It's fun to be creative.
BH: That's amazing. You're multi-talented.
CC: What should I try next?
BH: Is there anything you find challenging?
CC: It's surprising that I haven't heard you talk before!
BH: Really?
CC: Does Kenshi Yonezu appear on TV often?
BH: Not much. I've seen him a few times.
CC: I will try to find his interviews or appearances.
BH: Sure, I'll help you find them.
